In this plan, eight-ton missiles would be launched at an asteroid that is near Earth. The purpose of these missiles would be to push the asteroid away from its path so that it does not hit Earth. But if the asteroid was already too close to Earth for this plan to work, the missiles would carry nuclear bombs instead. These nuclear bombs would explode and destroy the asteroid completely.

According to Campbell, the hero first refuses the call to go on an adventure. Then a guide, or helper, appears to assist them. After that, they make the decision to 'cross the line,' which means they choose to leave their normal world and travel into the 'special world,' which is the place where the adventure takes place. In the next stage, the hero goes through tests, fights against enemies, and meets new friends who support them. The hero gets ready to face their biggest and most difficult challenge. For Luke Skywalker, the guide, or helper, is Obi-Wan Kenobi. The friends who help Luke are Han Solo and the robots R2D2 and C3PO. The enemy that Luke has to face is Darth Vader, who is inside the 'special world' called the Death Star.

Some things may seem not very important to some people. However, these things could be useful and helpful to other people. The internet has made it possible for online groups and communities to make money by sharing these items that are not used very much. People use websites and social media groups to buy and sell used things, also called second-hand things. Because of this, it is now easier for people to share items with each other. This way of sharing and using items is called the sharing economy.

Around the 18th and 19th centuries, two main ideas about dreams became popular and were widely discussed. One idea was that the things we see in our dreams represent or show things that are hidden or secret from our conscious, aware mind. Freud believed that if we understand what dreams are trying to tell us, we can understand our hidden or secret feelings. These hidden feelings can sometimes cause problems in our lives. The other theory was completely different and said the opposite. It explained that dreams are not meaningful but are simply a collection of random, unplanned activity in the brain. This random activity happens while the brain is organising and sorting memories and events from the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these random images and feelings from the dream. We combine them and turn them into a story to understand them better.

I am a freelancer, which means I work for myself and do not have a boss. This is great because I can control what I do and how I spend my time each day. At first, I worked from home, which means I did my work in my house. I thought it was hard to concentrate because there were too many distractions around me. For example, I needed to do housework, like cleaning or washing dishes. I also made another cup of tea instead of working. On top of that, my family members wanted my attention for different things, like talking to them or helping them with something. Because of these problems, I started going to a café close to my house to work. However, the Wi-Fi connection in the café was not good, which made it hard to work online. I also drank too much coffee while I was there, which was not healthy for me. In the end, I decided to rent a desk in a co-working space, which is a shared office where people like me, who also work for themselves, can work together. I share this space with five other freelancers who are similar to me. I liked getting dressed in the morning to go to work because it made me feel more professional. I also liked being able to focus better in an office, where it is quieter and there are fewer distractions.

NASA’s ability to find the remaining middle-sized near-Earth objects (NEOs) depends on getting enough money to build a special telescope called NEOCam. NEOCam is a 0.5-metre space telescope that would use infrared light, which is a type of light that we cannot see with our eyes, to find asteroids. If NASA received the money it needs, it would probably be able to achieve its goal of finding these asteroids in ten years. After recording and identifying the asteroids, the planetary protection team would still need to decide what actions to take to protect the planet from being hit by the very dangerous asteroids. These dangerous asteroids are called potentially hazardous asteroids (PHAs).

The 'buy nothing' trend, which means not buying new things, has now become popular with influencers on social media. These influencers are people who usually share posts about clothing and make-up that they recommend for other people to buy. However, now some YouTube stars are encouraging their viewers not to buy anything at all for long periods of time, such as for an entire year. For example, two friends in Canada decided to spend a whole year trying to buy only food and nothing else. During the first three months of this year, they learned how to live without buying electrical items, clothes, or things for the house, such as furniture or decorations. In the next stage of their experiment, they stopped using services. For example, they stopped getting haircuts, stopped eating out at restaurants, and stopped buying fuel for their cars. By the end of the year, they managed to save $55,000.

Religion is very important to Pi. His family follows the Hindu religion, but he is also curious about other religions. He becomes friends with a Christian priest, a man who works in a church and teaches about Christianity. He also becomes friends with a Muslim baker, a man who makes bread and follows the Muslim religion. Everyone feels surprised when Pi says that he is Hindu, Muslim, and Christian all at the same time. His family and his teachers ask him to pick just one religion to follow. However, Pi says no and explains, "I just want to love God." After hearing this, his family and teachers decide to let Pi make his own choices about what he believes in religion.

Some people think that writing your dreams down can help you have lucid dreams. Lucid dreams are dreams where you know that you are dreaming while you are still asleep. In these dreams, you can make decisions to change what happens in the dream. For example, you can turn a scary dream into a dream that feels safe and calm. You can also control the story of your dream, just like a film director controls the story of a movie. Instead of only trying to understand the meaning of your dreams, you will be creating your own dreams. However, you might still want to have some dreams that allow your subconscious mind to show you what you are thinking about or feeling deep inside.

People might not understand that they are part of the problem of disposable clothing, which means clothing that is thrown away after a short time. This is because they give their unwanted clothes, which are clothes they no longer need, to charities. However, charity shops cannot sell all of these unwanted clothes. 'Fast fashion,' which is clothing made quickly and cheaply to follow trends, goes out of fashion very quickly, meaning it becomes unpopular in a short time. Also, it is often too poor in quality to recycle, which means it cannot be reused to make new clothes. People do not want to buy this type of clothing second-hand, meaning clothes that someone else has already worn. As a result, huge amounts of clothes are thrown away. Many of the clothes that charities cannot sell are sent to other countries. This creates more economic problems, which are problems related to money, and environmental problems, which are problems that harm nature and the planet.

Some of today's adventurers are not happy with just one amazing trip. They want more excitement, so they go from one challenge to another. Meagan McGrath is a woman from Canada. She has climbed the tallest mountain on each continent in the world. She has also ridden a bicycle across the entire country of Canada. In addition, she has run a very long-distance race in the Sahara Desert, where the temperature was 45ºC. Her most incredible and amazing journey might be a skiing trip to the South Pole. On the very first day of this trip, she fell into a glacier, which is a large area of ice. She had to be rescued and saved by others. Many people would have stopped and given up at that point. However, Meagan decided to keep going and not quit. She reached the South Pole forty days later. During this trip, she pulled a heavy sledge, which is like a sled, behind her. The sledge carried a tent and all her food. She did all of this while traveling through freezing cold weather and dangerous ice storms.

Blek le Rat started painting small animals, like rats, on the walls of his home city, Paris. Now, he tries to make people think about different social issues and problems, such as the difficulties some people face in life. For example, he paints pictures of people who do not have homes in big cities. He wants to encourage people living in the city to think more carefully about the problem of not having a home and how it affects others.

In some areas, local governments have tried to stop artists from painting graffiti randomly on walls. They have done this by allowing artists to work in specific places where it is permitted. For example, Taiwan is one place where this happens. There are special 'graffiti areas' in Taiwan. In these areas, artists can paint and write on walls without any restrictions or rules stopping them. Similarly, in São Paulo, which is a city in Brazil, the city government has allowed some graffiti artists to paint on the walls of the city's subway trains.

Faith47 is from Cape Town, which is a city in South Africa. She paints big and colourful pictures of people and animals. She enjoys visiting and exploring different places. People can see her artwork on pavements, inside empty factories, and even on empty cars. She likes the fact that most street art does not stay forever. This is because it will soon be removed by the weather, like rain or wind, or by cleaners who work for the city government. For her, this shows that life is always changing. Life has a cycle, which means it has endings and also new beginnings.

Gabriela was used to working in a culture where there is a high power distance in her previous work environment. In this type of culture, power and authority are highly respected. Everyone knows their proper place in the hierarchy, which means everyone knows who is in charge and who follows. Leaders are the ones who make big and important decisions. These decisions are not often questioned or challenged by others. However, her Swedish team was used to working in a culture with a low power distance. In this type of culture, employees who work under the boss, called subordinates, often cooperate and work together with their bosses to find solutions to problems and to make decisions. Leaders in this culture act more like coaches or guides. They encourage people to think for themselves and to share their own ideas. Leaders in this culture also expect others to question or challenge their decisions.

When Gabriela noticed the cultural differences between her and her team, she decided to have an open conversation with them to understand their perspectives better. She asked them about their feelings and opinions regarding how she guided and managed them. Gabriela's team was happy to share their honest thoughts and experiences with her. They explained that they were not used to being told exactly what to do all the time. Instead, they liked having more freedom to make their own decisions, take action, and come up with new ideas. When Gabriela gave her team detailed instructions and told them exactly what she needed them to do, they felt that she did not trust them or believe they could do their job well on their own. The team also understood that Gabriela felt upset and took it personally when they tried to question or change her decisions. They explained to Gabriela that this was the way they had always worked in their previous jobs or experiences.

Os Gêmeos are twin brothers from São Paulo, a large city in Brazil. They paint many different things, such as names and huge, colourful pictures of people on the sides of buildings. Their work is often very big, so they need cranes, which are large machines, to help them reach high places and do their work. For example, in 2007, they painted the entire outside of a big, old building in Scotland.

People have painted and written on walls throughout history, which means they have done this for a very long time. In prehistoric times, which is the time before people started writing, people in Africa and Europe used to paint pictures of animals and people in shelters, which are places where they lived or stayed to protect themselves. Graffiti, which means drawings or writings on walls, has been discovered on buildings at ancient sites in Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. Archaeologists, who are people that study old things from the past, have discovered many examples of graffiti in the Roman town of Pompeii. These examples were written in Latin, which was the language spoken by the Romans. The graffiti includes religious messages about gods, political messages about leaders or events, and romantic messages about love. Some of the graffiti are even magic spells, which are words or phrases people believed could create magic!

Have you ever dreamed of climbing the tallest mountain in the world, like Mount Everest? Have you ever dreamed of walking all the way to the South Pole, which is one of the coldest places on Earth? If you have dreamed about these things, you are not the only one. Every year, thousands of people try to climb the tallest mountains in the world, like Mount Everest or K2. Many other people also try to walk long distances across entire continents, such as Africa or Asia. In the past, explorers used tools like maps and compasses to find their way. However, today's adventurers travel using modern tools like GPS devices and mobile phones, which are much easier to use. Many adventurers love spending time in nature. They use their trips to help other people learn more about problems with the environment, like pollution or climate change. Other adventurers want to help people who are in need, such as people who do not have enough food or clean water. These adventurers also want to collect money to support charities that help people.

The first mission is called DART. DART stands for the Double Asteroid Redirection Test, which is a test designed to change the path of an asteroid's moon. Scientists have made plans to test DART on the moon of an asteroid. The asteroid is named Didymos. The moon of this asteroid, which is called 'Didymoon', is 150 metres wide. Didymoon moves in a circular path, or orbits, around its larger mother asteroid, which is 800 metres wide. It is expected that when DART hits Didymoon, the impact will push Didymoon enough to change its orbit. After this happens, telescopes on Earth will be able to see and measure this change in Didymoon's orbit.

The main character, or heroine, of the story is a sixteen-year-old girl named Katniss Everdeen. She lost her father because of an accident that happened while he was working. Because of this, she has to take care of her family and make sure they have enough food to eat. To do this, she goes hunting in the forests near District 12 with her friend Gale. Over time, she becomes very good at using a weapon called a bow, which is used to shoot arrows. Katniss has a younger sister named Prim. Prim is chosen to be one of the people who must take part in a dangerous event. Katniss does not want her sister to go, so she decides to go in her place. Another person from District 12 is also chosen to take part. This person is a boy named Peeta. After they are both chosen, Katniss quickly finds herself in a complicated and difficult relationship with Peeta.

Writing about your dreams shows that you will start to remember more details about the dream. For example, you can think about the people in the dream and the place where the dream happened. These details might add to the meaning of the dream. If you write about your dreams every day for a week, you will be surprised by how much you have written down. After that, you can connect your dreams to the events and feelings that happen in your daily life.

In the past, more bridges were made of wood, which is a material that can burn easily. These wooden bridges were much more likely to catch fire and burn. This was especially true for old train bridges, which were used by trains. The heat from the metal wheels of the trains and the metal tracks could sometimes cause a wooden bridge to catch fire and burn completely.

It is impossible to know how street art will change or grow in the future. However, some clear trends are starting to appear. Most street artists are young people who paint in their own city or in their local neighbourhood. At the same time, more and more street artists are travelling to other places and working in different countries. In addition, other artists are using the internet to talk to each other and share photos of their work with people online. The art world is also paying more attention to street art and is starting to see it as a real and important type of art. We do not know exactly what will happen to street art in the future. However, we can be sure that street art will continue to exist and stay important!

Suzanne Collins has always thought that news programmes about wars are very upsetting and make people feel sad or worried. When she was a child, her father worked as a pilot in the US Air Force, which is part of the military in the United States. He fought as a soldier in the Vietnam War. Suzanne's mother tried to protect her from the scary things happening in the war. Her mother did not tell her about what was happening in the war. However, Suzanne still watched news programmes about the war on television. She understood that her dad was there in Vietnam, fighting in the war. This was a very frightening and scary experience for her as a child.

PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), which is a large company that provides professional services, carried out a global survey. In this survey, more than 40,000 millennials, who are people born between 1983 and 1993, and non-millennials, who are people born before or after that time, gave their responses. The survey was about topics like work culture, communication and working styles, pay structure, career growth, and work–life balance. Deloitte, which is another large professional services company, also carried out a separate global survey. In this survey, more than 10,000 millennials participated. These participants shared their opinions about the risks, challenges, and opportunities in the complicated and changing world of work.

Erik Weihenmayer is from the United States. He is an adventurer who does many different activities. For example, he has ridden a bike through the hot and dry deserts of Morocco. He has kayaked through the large and famous Grand Canyon. He has also climbed Mount Everest, the highest mountain in the world. Erik has not been able to see anything since he was 13 years old because he is blind. In addition to his adventures, he tries to encourage and inspire people who have difficulties or disabilities to live active and exciting lives. For example, he takes groups of young people who cannot see on mountain climbing trips.

Online platforms are giving people a chance to make money quickly and easily. For example, busy parents might not have taken the time to set up a table at the local market or at a car boot sale to sell their children's old items in the past. However, now, with online shopping websites, parents can sell baby clothes that their children no longer wear. In addition, they can also sell expensive pushchairs and baby equipment that they bought for their children. This process helps them get some of their money back.

Pi and Richard Parker spend 227 days in the lifeboat, which is a small boat used for emergencies. During these 227 days, they live through a lack of food, illness, and extreme tiredness. They also face violent storms and the burning heat of the Pacific sun, which is very strong and hot. In some way, they manage to survive all these difficulties. Sometimes, Pi finds comfort and peace in his three religions, which help him feel better. At other times, he feels very lonely and full of sadness and hopelessness. Finally, the Mexican coast appears far away in the distance. After that, everything changes for them. It would be a pity to tell you the ending of the story now. You will have to read the book yourself to find out what happens to Pi and Richard Parker when they finally see land.

Chloe arrived home from school. She made herself a cup of coffee, which is a hot drink, and took it to her bedroom. She had some homework to do, but that could wait for later because she wanted to relax first. She wanted to enjoy the quiet hour before her parents arrived home. After her parents arrived, the house would fill with the evening sounds of people talking, the television playing, or her dad listening to his favorite jazz music while he cooked dinner in the kitchen. She liked this time of day too because it was peaceful. During this time, she could play with her pet rats, which were small animals she kept in her room.

In 2010, the team at NASA that works on protecting the planet from space objects identified and recorded 90 per cent of the asteroids near Earth that are 1 kilometre wide. These 'near-Earth objects', also called NEOs, are as big as mountains. They include any space objects that come within 50 million kilometres of Earth's path around the Sun. NASA believes that 50 asteroids are still not recorded. NASA also says that none of the 887 known asteroids are a serious danger to the planet.

Auggie makes the decision to go to school for the first time. After deciding this, he has to face his first day at school. Like every child who is starting at a new school, he feels very nervous and worried. Because of the way he looks, his first day is a very painful and difficult experience for him. Nobody wants to sit next to him in class or at lunch. He notices that other kids are looking at him in a way that makes him feel uncomfortable. He also sees them talking about him quietly, covering their mouths with their hands so he cannot hear what they are saying. Fortunately, not everything is bad. He makes a new friend named Jack. Jack is a boy in his class, and they get along well. He also makes another friend named Summer. Summer is a girl he talks to during lunch, and she is kind to him. However, it is not just the first day at school that is hard for Auggie. He soon finds out that many of his classmates do not want to touch him. They are afraid that if they touch him, they will catch something they call 'the plague,' even though this is not true. As the school year goes on, Auggie has many strong and emotional experiences. Some of these experiences are happy and positive, but others are very hard and sad for him. Finally, during a school camp, something surprising and very traumatic happens. This event changes everything for Auggie and his classmates.

The two men looked towards the northern end of the property. The property stretched as far as they could see, meaning it was very large and seemed endless from their position. The fences around the property were barely visible from where they stood because of the distance. A teenage boy might feel bored and act rebellious because of the isolation and lack of things to do. However, it was not possible to escape the property on foot because it was so far from everything else. Sam turned his attention to the biggest horse in the area. The horse was kicking at the ground with its heavy hooves, making a loud and powerful sound. Sam started to wonder if the boy knew how to ride a horse. If someone was a good rider, they could get into a lot of trouble in this area because it was so far from other people and help. They were miles away from anyone else, meaning they were in a very remote and lonely place. However, there could be even more danger for someone who did not know anything about horses. That kind of person might want to run away from his father, but it would be very risky.

Over 4,000 climbers have reached the top of Mount Everest, which is the highest mountain in the world. These climbers are between thirteen years old and eighty years old. Climbing very high mountains in freezing cold conditions and during violent storms is still very dangerous. However, the best climbers in the world now look for new challenges because they want to achieve more difficult goals. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner, who is from Austria, fell in love with mountain climbing when she was a teenager. After she finished school, she worked as a nurse. Even though she worked as a nurse, she continued climbing mountains during her free time.

Gerlinde climbed Mount Everest, which is the highest mountain in the world. After this, she decided to climb all fourteen of the world's mountains that are 8,000 metres high or more. To make it more difficult for herself, Gerlinde climbs these mountains without using oxygen bottles to help her breathe. This is very dangerous because the low levels of oxygen at the top of very high mountains can harm the brain and the body. Gerlinde is a famous and well-known climber. She uses her popularity and fame to support a charity that helps poor children and children without parents, who are called orphans, in Nepal.

If we look around us at the things we have bought in our lives, we will notice something important. Not everything we own is used in a good way or used often. For example, there is the thick woollen coat. We thought it looked fashionable, but we live in a hot country, so we do not need it. There is the smartphone that we stopped using because we got the newest model of smartphone. There is the car that we only use on the weekends, and it stays unused for most of the week. There is also the guest room in our house, which we do not use for guests anymore. Instead, it turned into a storeroom where we keep extra things.

Dreams have been connected to predicting the future throughout history and in many different cultures. People believed that dreams were messages sent by the gods. These messages were sent to provide us with knowledge or to help us understand something important. Even today, many people can remember a time when they had a dream about an event, a place, or a person. Later, they saw that the dream actually happened in real life.

Some of the largest and most expensive transportation projects in the world involve building bridges. Bridges are important connections that link places together. They carry vehicles such as cars, trucks, and trains over water, deep valleys like mountain gorges, or even over other roads. Because of this, bridges are one of the most important parts of creating and planning structures for transportation. People study and check bridges very carefully, especially when they collapse or fall down.

Gabriela was upset for many weeks and felt unhappy. She sent an email to her Swedish manager to tell him about the problems she was having with her team. Her manager asked her if she believed that her team was still performing well and doing their work properly. He also asked her what she thought could make it easier for her to work better with the other members of her team. Gabriela thought that her manager was not clear in his words and questions. She also felt that he was not handling the situation in a good or effective way.

Dogs that live together in groups have learnt something very important. They have learnt that humans are more likely to give food to smaller and cuter dogs than to bigger or less cute dogs. Because of this, the smaller and cuter dogs are sent by the group to ask for food for everyone in the group. Some dogs have also learnt how to use the city's metro system, which is the train system in the city. They use the metro to travel from one part of their area to another part of their area. Scientists are not completely sure how the dogs know when to get off the train at the right station. One idea is that the dogs use their very strong sense of smell. They might have learnt to recognise the smells of their favourite places, such as parks or areas where they find food. Another idea is that the dogs have learnt to recognise the names of the train stations from the announcements that are made on the train. In any case, metro passengers, or people who ride the trains, are now used to seeing dogs on the trains. The dogs travel on the metro without being noticed by most of the local people who live in the city.

Ed Stafford, who is from the UK, is the first person in history to walk the entire length of the Amazon River. He began his journey at a small river located in the Andes mountains in Peru. After two years and four months of walking, he finally arrived at the mouth of the Amazon River in Brazil. In total, he walked 6,000 kilometres. The Amazon rainforest is a dangerous place because it is home to animals like poisonous snakes, crocodiles, and jaguars. Ed was always in danger because of these animals. Fortunately, he survived the journey. The worst thing that happened to him was getting a few thousand bites from insects and ants.

In Britain, the average person spends more than £1,000 on new clothes each year. This amount of money is about four per cent of the money they earn in a year. That might not seem like a lot of money. However, this number hides two bigger and more serious problems for society and the environment. First, a large part of this spending is done using credit cards, which means people are borrowing money to buy clothes. British people owe about £670 per adult to credit card companies. This amount is 66 per cent of the average money people spend on their clothes. Also, people are not only spending money they don’t have, but they are also buying clothes they don’t really need. Every year, Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothing. Most of these clothes are thrown into landfill sites, which are places where garbage is buried in the ground.

Ed's walk would have been impossible without technology because technology helped him in many ways. He used a radio to ask the people who live in the rainforest for food. He also used the radio to ask for permission to cross their land. Many people from the rainforest came to meet him. These people helped guide him through the most difficult areas of the rainforest. Ed wrote a blog as he walked through the rainforest. In the blog, he recorded his day-to-day experiences, which means he wrote about what happened each day. He used the media interest in his trip to protest about the damage being done to the rainforest. He also raised money to help environmental charities and children's charities in Brazil and Peru.

Businesses have realized that the sharing economy helps them make money. Because of this, they want to benefit by using resources that are not completely used, such as rooms, houses, or cars. A popular business model is when companies provide an online platform. This online platform connects customers with people who can offer a product or service, such as a place to stay or a ride. For example, Airbnb helps people rent out their unused rooms and houses as places for others to stay. Another example is Uber. Uber allows people to use their own cars as taxis so they can earn extra money during their free time.

Zoos have an important role in the world today. They help with international breeding programmes, especially for animals that are in danger of disappearing, which means they are at risk of becoming extinct. In the wild, some of the rarest animals have problems finding partners to mate with and having babies. These animals are also in danger because of people who hunt them, the loss of their natural homes or living areas, and other animals that hunt them for food. A good zoo helps these animals stay alive and have babies in a safe and protected place. In addition, when the number of wild animals in a group becomes very low, there is a bigger risk that the animals in the group will become too similar to each other. Breeding programmes help solve this problem by increasing the differences between animals in the group. Animals that are born in zoos can also be released into the wild to help make wild animal groups more diverse.

Both of these types of accidents almost never happen because they are very uncommon. Boats and trains can make a bridge collapse for different reasons. For trains, the very fast speed of the crash can cause a bridge to fall down. For boats, their very large size can make the bridge collapse, even if the boats are moving very slowly when it happens. The best way to prevent bridge problems is to plan for these issues before they happen. Modern technologies can help to find problems in the structure of bridges. Safer working environments for builders and better designs for bridges can also help to lower the number of these terrible accidents.

At first, Pi is very scared of the animals on the lifeboat. Because he is so afraid, he jumps into the ocean. Then he remembers that there are hungry sharks swimming in the water around him, and they could attack him. He realises that his only option to stay safe is to climb back into the lifeboat. One by one, the animals in the lifeboat fight, kill, and eat each other. In the end, only Pi and the tiger are left alive on the lifeboat. Fortunately for Pi, the tiger is seasick, so it feels too sick and has no immediate interest in eating him. Pi decides to name the tiger Richard Parker.

When Pi is 16 years old, a new government is chosen to lead the country. His parents do not agree with or support this new government. Pi's parents feel worried and concerned about what the future will be like under this government. Because of this, they make a decision to close their zoo and move to Canada to start a new life. Some of the zoo animals are sold to other zoos located in North America. The family travels by ship to Canada, and they take some of the animals with them on the ship. While they are on the way to Canada, there is a very terrible and dangerous storm. Because of the storm, the ship sinks in the ocean. Sadly and tragically, Pi's family and all the sailors on the ship die in the water. Pi survives, but he finds himself alone in a small lifeboat. However, he is not completely alone because there are animals with him in the lifeboat. These animals include a hyena, a zebra, an orang-utan, and a very large tiger.

The Hunger Games is a very popular and successful book for teenagers and young adults. The book was written by the American writer Suzanne Collins. It was first published in the year 2008. Since that time, it has been translated into 26 different languages, meaning it can now be read by people who speak those languages. Millions of copies of the book have been sold all over the world. It is also the first book for young readers to sell more than a million electronic copies, which are digital versions of the book that people can read on devices like tablets or e-readers. The Hunger Games has also been made into a big Hollywood movie. The movie is just as successful as the book. For example, it earned 152.5 million dollars in its first weekend in North America alone, which shows how many people went to watch it!

Maybe dreams happen because our mind is organising the thoughts we have during the day. These thoughts show up in dreams with a deeper meaning, which means they are more important or emotional. When we are awake, most of our thoughts come into our minds as words. These words are similar to the conversations we have with ourselves in our heads. However, when we are asleep, the part of our brain that helps us use and understand language becomes less active, or less busy. At the same time, the part of our brain that controls our feelings and emotions becomes more active, or busier.

Having good relationships with other people is a very important part of staying happy and feeling good. In one study, researchers found out that most happy people had strong and close connections to their friends and family members. These happy people made sure that they spent time with their friends and family often, meaning they saw them regularly. You also need at least one person in your life who you can talk to about your personal feelings, like how you feel inside or what you are thinking about deeply. This is called 'sharing personal thoughts', which means talking about things that are very private or important to you. Even just one person to have a deep and meaningful conversation with is enough to help you feel connected. Besides this, you also need a group of other relationships, meaning you need other friends or people to spend time with. However, it is not enough to only have many friends for doing fun activities or talking about things like music or football. That deeper, more meaningful connection with at least one person is very important for happiness. Some people need to learn how to listen carefully and well to others because this skill helps them build stronger and better relationships with people around them.

Expert Carol Dweck supports the idea of a 'growth mindset', which means believing that people can improve and learn through effort. She spoke about how the brain can change and how we can develop skills and talents over time. For example, we might not have been good at these skills when we first started, but we can improve with practice. Many people focus their compliments on the final result and natural talents. For example, they say things like, 'You really notice details' or 'You are very good at organising events'. However, research shows that focusing on the process, which means how someone works to achieve something, is better. It is good to give compliments about effort, trying new things, and problem-solving strategies. For example, you can say, 'You worked really hard on this' or 'You found a smart way to solve the problem'. This can help people develop new skills and improve their talents over time.

The rover studies the air around it regularly to learn more about the environment. In 2014, the rover discovered that the air had methane gas in it. Methane is one of the simplest natural molecules, and it is also an important part of natural gas that people use on Earth. Methane only stays in the air for a few hundred years before disappearing. This means that something on Mars is creating more methane gas to replace what disappears. NASA explains that Mars releases thousands of tons of methane gas at one time. The amount of methane in the air changes during different seasons of the year, like summer or winter. It is almost like the planet is breathing in and out methane gas.

Early in her career, the teacher Carol Dweck, who works at Stanford University, gave a group of ten-year-old children some problems to solve. These problems were a little too difficult for the children to complete easily. One group of children reacted in a positive way. They said they loved the challenges, and they understood that their skills and abilities could improve and grow over time. Carol Dweck says these children had what she calls a 'growth mindset'. This means they were focused on what they could achieve in the future, even if they could not solve the problems right now. Another group of children reacted differently. They felt that the problems were a test of how smart they were. They thought that they had failed because they could not solve the problems. Carol Dweck says these children had a 'fixed mindset'. This means they believed their intelligence could not improve, and they could not imagine getting better at solving problems. Some of these children even said they might cheat in the future to avoid feeling like they had failed. Other children in this group looked for someone who had done worse than them. Seeing someone else perform worse made them feel better about themselves.

Horror films often use empty places because they create a scary atmosphere. These empty places could be an old hospital where no one works anymore, a scary and empty house where no one lives, or even a ghost town where all the people have left. There is something strange and mysterious about lonely and empty places. People might wonder, what were these places like when people used to live or work there? Why did all the people leave these places? Maybe these places feel scary because they are so quiet, and quiet places can make people feel nervous or afraid. Of course, empty places are also very helpful for horror film directors. For example, it is easier to believe that you will not have a phone signal in empty places like these.

It does not matter what kind of house it is because all types of houses can have scary parts. The lower floor is always a scary place in horror films. This is usually the place where something is hiding, like a monster or a ghost. It is also the place where the bad psychopath has kept their tools, such as knives or other dangerous objects. Lower floors are always dark, which makes them feel even scarier. They are often damp, meaning they feel wet and cold. You can only reach the lower floors by going down a narrow staircase, which can feel uncomfortable or unsafe. Lower floors are always creepy. They are creepy even when there is nothing down there to scare you.

Gary Collins was a policeman who was not working at the time. He was watching the London protests on TV at home. While watching, he immediately recognized several people in the crowd. Because of this, he decided to cut his holiday short so that he could help the police with identifying who these people were. For six months, he worked on going through the CCTV video recordings of the protests. During this time, he managed to identify 190 people. He was able to recognize many of them just by looking at their eyes. His help was very important in the investigation. There were 200,000 hours of video recordings in total, but the facial recognition software could only identify one person.

Personally, I think it is very interesting to think about how we, as humans, will make our progress faster by improving our bodies. For example, imagine if you could put a computer inside your brain to help you think better! In the near future, we will be able to do this, and it will improve our skills with numbers, understanding things we see and hear, and remembering information. This idea is going to become more and more popular and accepted by people.

It was a very interesting and engaging talk. The speaker explained things very clearly and in a way that was easy to understand. For example, she talked about how parents influence their children. She gave an example to make this clear: How can we expect teenagers not to send text messages while doing their homework? Teenagers see their parents posting messages or pictures on social media while they are cooking dinner or waiting at a red traffic light. The speaker also talked about how people want to be in two or more places at the same time. For example, they switch between having real-life conversations and having online conversations. I notice this happening with my teenage daughter and her friends. They make plans to meet and spend time together, but then, when they are sitting together, they do not talk to each other. Instead, each one is busy with a different conversation happening online.

News stories sometimes make us think that the world is becoming more violent. However, there is some reason to feel hopeful about the situation. Between the end of World War II, which ended in 1945, and the year 1990, 30 wars killed more than 100,000 people each. Today, there are still internal wars, which are wars that happen within a country. However, countries are now living more calmly and peacefully than they did in the past. Attacks, though, have increased in the last few years, meaning that there are now more attacks than before. Since World War II, wars have killed more ordinary people, such as civilians, than soldiers who are trained to fight in wars. Even for ordinary people, the numbers are not all bad. Deaths from violent crime, such as murder or robbery, are nine times more likely than deaths from political fighting, which includes deaths caused by wars or political conflicts. However, the global murder rate, which is the number of murders per 100,000 people, fell slightly. It went down from 8 per 100,000 people in the year 2000 to about 5.3 per 100,000 people in the year 2015.

Wasfia has dedicated her life to supporting human rights, which means protecting the basic freedoms and rights of all people. She has seen many international aid projects, which are programs from other countries that try to help, in her home country of Bangladesh. These projects aim to teach and train women and girls so they can have better opportunities. However, when these projects have stopped running, the women and girls have often been left with nothing and no support. Wasfia realized that Bangladesh needed to stand up for itself and take action to improve the situation. She combined her two passions, which are climbing mountains and supporting human rights, to try and change how people in her country think about women. She started climbing mountains while she was working on aid campaigns, or programs to help people, in Tibet and Nepal. Bangladesh is a country that is low and mostly flat, meaning it does not have mountains, so most people there have never seen a mountain in real life. Her campaign, or her organized effort to bring change, seems to be working. People in her country are starting to notice what she is doing, and people in other parts of the world are noticing too.

Most people think that developing countries are in a very bad situation. They believe that these countries are experiencing extreme poverty, are ruled by very strict and controlling leaders, and have very little hope for change or improvement. However, this belief is not true. A big and important change is happening in these countries. In the last 20 years, more than 700 million people have started earning more money and have escaped from poverty. In addition, six million fewer children die every year from diseases that used to kill many children in the past. Also, millions more girls are now able to go to school, and millions of people now have access to clean and safe water to drink.

Many managers try to include positive feedback or encouraging words in their comments. They do this by placing negative feedback or criticism between two positive comments. However, when this practice becomes a routine or happens too often, employees may start to think that positive comments are only used to hide the negative ones. This can make the positive comments less meaningful or less valuable. Positive comments should not only be used to soften or cushion the negative feedback. They should also be used to encourage employees and support their good performance.

I am a member of the Campaign to Stop Killer Robots. Forget the movie image of a scary robot like the Terminator stepping on human bones. Instead, think about what is happening right now in the real world. Machines used in war, such as drones, gun turrets, and sentry robots, are already being used to kill people with very little human control. The next step in this technology will be autonomous robots. These robots will follow commands, but they will decide on their own who to kill. I believe this would be completely wrong and very dangerous for humans. We need to be very careful and think hard about what tasks we ask machines to do.

In general, more people are learning English than all other languages combined together. English is spoken in the largest number of countries around the world. However, Chinese has the highest number of people who speak it as their first language, or native language. There is not much connection between the number of native speakers of a language and the number of people who are learning that language. On the other hand, there is a closer connection between the number of people learning a language and the number of countries where that language is spoken.

Your manager stops you while you are working. She says that she needs to talk to you about how you performed during the recent project. You feel worried about this conversation all weekend. You keep thinking and wondering what mistakes you might have made or what you might have done wrong. On Monday morning, you walk into her office. She begins the conversation by saying positive things about the work you did on the project. You start to wonder if this is just the usual polite comment at the beginning of what people call the 'feedback sandwich.' You remember how the feedback sandwich works. First, the person says something positive to make you feel good. Then, they say the main point, which is usually the criticism or the real feedback they want to give. Finally, they end with another positive comment to make the conversation feel less negative.

Born in the USA is a fast and lively rock music album. Its words express strong emotions and feelings. The catchy and memorable rock tunes support these powerful songs. Behind the music, there are stories about the negative and difficult side of the American dream. Many of the songs talk about the struggles and problems of hard-working, normal, everyday people. These songs show the sadness and frustration that these people feel when their lives do not bring them wealth, riches, or success. For example, the song Glory Days is about people living in a small town. These people think about their younger years, remembering a time when they felt like they could achieve anything and had great opportunities in life. Another song, Downbound Train, tells the story of a young man whose life falls apart after he loses his job. It is easy to imagine that the artist is thinking about real people he knew in the past. He might also be thinking about the life he could have lived if he had not become a famous music star. The album shows the unique and amazing talent of the artist, who is often called "the Boss."

Lewis would like the number of protected sea areas in the world to increase from 3 per cent to 10 per cent. He believes this increase could help fix the damage that has been caused by human activity. This damage includes catching too many fish (overfishing), polluting the water with harmful substances, and throwing trash into the sea. During his trips, Lewis has seen this environmental damage with his own eyes. For example, he has swum over coral reefs that turned white (bleached) because the water temperature became too high. He has also seen underwater deserts in the shallow waters of the Red Sea. These underwater deserts have no life, like fish or plants, and are covered with plastic trash. Pugh believes that nature can recover and become healthy again if it is given enough space and time to heal. However, time is running out quickly. If we do not start taking care of our seas now, we may soon face a problem that we will not be able to solve.

Terrie Sharp is a very popular and successful author who has sold many books. She knows how to tell a good story that people enjoy. She has won the Olive Crime Writer Award two times, which is a big achievement for a writer. She was born in a very poor area in Glasgow, a city in Scotland. This area was known for having the highest crime rate, meaning there was more crime there than in any other part of the city. When she was growing up, she learned to stay quiet and avoid getting into trouble. She also learned how to open car doors using a knife, which is something people sometimes do to steal cars. However, she was lucky because she only used this skill to create interesting ideas for her novels. These days, she is not so quiet anymore. She goes on popular daytime television shows, such as Police Today, where many people watch her. She also gives speeches and talks about writing at conferences all over the UK.

Are things becoming worse every day, or is it just how it feels? Is making progress something we can never achieve? In the book Enlightenment Now, Steven Pinker examines how humans have progressed over time and shares positive news. He explains that we are now living longer lives, we are healthier, we have more freedom, and we are happier than before. Pinker says that the real issue is that important values, like using reason and trusting science, are being attacked. He warns that when people focus too much on being loyal to their own groups, feel hopeless about the future, and stop trusting others, we might harm important systems. These systems include fair governments and the ability to work together with other countries around the world.

In older horror films, the main characters were often in a state of desperation and fear. It was very difficult or even impossible for them to call for help or contact the police. Nowadays, cell phones have made this type of situation harder to believe because people can easily call for help. So, what is the solution to keep the suspense and fear in these movies? The answer is that there is no phone signal! If you are the main character in a horror film, it is almost certain that, at an important moment when you need to call for help, you will not have any phone signal. Your phone battery might also run out while you are trying to make a call. Sometimes, both of these problems happen at the same time.

In the 1950s, commercial banana growers in Central America were dealing with the loss of their most successful type of banana. This type of banana was called the Gros Michel banana, which people also called Big Mike. Now, the same problem is happening to the new type of Big Mike. This new type is called the Cavendish banana. The Gros Michel banana plant produced bananas that were easy to transport because they had thick skin and a sweet flavor. This plant was the main type of banana grown on the large farms, called plantations, in Central America. At that time, a company called United Fruit was the biggest grower and seller of bananas in South America. The company grew bananas in the easiest way possible. Instead of planting seeds, it copied parts of the banana plants, called shoots, to grow new plants. The company also planted the banana plants very close together in fields that were extremely crowded.

Spider venom is found in most kinds of spiders. Spiders use this venom to make their food unable to move or to kill it. However, spiders do not use their venom to attack humans. Out of all the known types of spiders, only 25 produce venom that can harm humans. Spider bites can hurt and cause pain, but they almost never cause death. For example, Australia's Sydney funnel-web spider has not caused any deaths since a special medicine, called anti-venom, was created in 1981 to treat its bites. You should be careful not to touch hairy spiders, such as tarantulas, in the wrong way. When tarantulas feel that they are in danger, they protect themselves by letting out a cloud of very small hairs. These tiny hairs can cause skin irritation and can get into the skin or the eyes of the person or animal that is attacking them.

This common idea in horror films was very popular in horror movies made in the late 20th century. It usually starts with a group of teenagers who are all having fun together and enjoying themselves. However, it usually ends with everyone in the group dead, except for one girl. At the beginning of the story, this girl is usually innocent, shy, and not very strong. But by the end of the story, she becomes the strongest and most clever person in the world. The last girl almost always survives and wins at the end of the movie.

If we want to understand where our ability to use complex language came from, we need to look at how our brains are different from the brains of other animals. This difference is about more than just the size of the brain. It is important to understand what other abilities our brains have. It is also important to understand when and why our brains changed in this way. There are very few physical signs or evidence to help us understand this. The tools and objects left by our early human relatives do not show us what kind of speech they were able to produce. However, there is one thing we can learn by looking at the bones of early humans. This is the development of the parts of the body used for speaking, such as the mouth, throat, and tongue. By about 100,000 years ago, humans had developed the ability to produce complex sounds. Before that time, scientists who study the history of humans can only make guesses about whether early humans used simpler sounds to communicate.

Society, not the natural world, tells us that girls should choose arts and subjects like history or literature. Society also tells us that maths and physics are subjects for boys, not girls. Moreover, there are not enough positive examples of women working in science-related jobs for young people to look up to. For example, cartoons and stories often show the crazy scientist, the brilliant inventor, or the adventurous astronaut as a man, not a woman. Many people also believe that scientists are nerdy, that they have poor social skills, or that their work is lonely and disconnected from the rest of the world. These are untrue ideas that are often shown by the media. However, these ideas can make girls feel that they are not like scientists and that science is not an interesting or suitable career choice for them. If girls could see more positive examples of women working in science, they would feel more confident about studying science. They would also feel like they belong in those subjects and careers.

The Scallion is printed every week, which means it is published once every seven days. It is given out for free in university buildings, so students and staff do not need to pay for it. About 10,000 students read the newspaper every week. Students are the ones who write the articles and produce the newspaper entirely by themselves. A survey shows that university students and staff think the newspaper is very important and valuable. They think it is important because it provides entertainment, helps them learn about culture, and gives students work experience. However, the cost of printing newspapers is very high, which means it is expensive to make. Also, some students have difficulty getting the paper because it is not easy to find. The only way to get a copy of the newspaper is to go to the university, which can be inconvenient for some students. Another problem is related to the environment. Many copies of the newspaper are not taken or used and are left as trash on the campus, which creates waste.

At Girox Foods, we are losing about 12 per cent of employees every year. This means that 12 out of every 100 employees leave the company each year. This might not seem like a high number at first, but the average percentage of employees leaving in this industry is only seven per cent. In other words, most companies in the same industry lose fewer employees than we do. The main goal of this report is to find out the reasons why employees stay involved in the company and why they choose to leave. Based on these reasons, the report gives ideas and suggestions to make the work environment better for employees. The goal is to help employees feel happier at work and to keep more of them working here for a longer time.

Much of what the speaker said felt true to me. I believe there is a danger in the way we live now. The more connected we are through technology, the more alone we feel in our personal lives. However, I don't think this is a big problem for people in my generation. We have lived without modern technology, such as smartphones and social media, for a long time. Because of this, we know how to spend time alone. More importantly, we understand that it is OK to be alone and that being alone can even be good for us. But young people who are under 20 years old are different. They are so busy communicating with others through their phones and devices that they never feel alone. As a result, they might not learn how to enjoy spending time by themselves. In addition, they are learning how to have conversations through text messages. These messages can be changed, edited, and fixed before they are sent. This happens instead of learning how to have real conversations, which take place in real time with a person who is right in front of them.

Do not always follow positive comments with negative comments. If you always say something positive and then immediately say something negative, people might not appreciate or value the positive things you say. Sometimes, you should give positive comments simply because they are good and make people feel happy. At those times, try not to give advice, even if it is helpful.
